TerrainBase

Class Patch

  • java.lang.Object
    • TerrainBase.Patch

  • public class Patch
extends java.lang.Object
    A patch is a container that subdivides as parent cell through the creation and association of child cells. The dimensions of the patch are determimed byt he dimensions of it's parent cell. The degree of subdivision is determined on an individual patch basis.
    Author:
    Philip Larby

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Patch(Cell parent)
      Construct a patch that fully subdivides a parent cell with the resolution specified in the Helpers class
      Patch(int xDef, int yDef, int zDef, Cell parent)
      Construct a patch that fully subdivides a parent cell with specified x, y, and z cell resolution

    • Method Detail

      • CellCount

        public int CellCount()
        Get the number of cells that exist as direct children to this patch. Not this is not the sum total of all possible child cells, as some may have been excluded if they are not intersected by the surface
        Returns:
        The number of cells

      • getParentCell

        public Cell getParentCell()
        Get a reference to the direct parent cell for this patch.
        Returns:
        the parent cell
